lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Good morning! Nice weather we're having today, right?

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Welcome in! Perfect timing, I've just finalised the forecast for the day.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Hmm. How good are you on slippery ground? I recommend sticking close to the wall to grab if you slip-- actually, can you grab things? Maybe you should fly.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Ugh, I slipped and fell in there once. My knees were bruised for days, be careful in there.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Well, I would tell you to step lightly because the planks over the river are quite old, but you wouldn't weight much so you might be fine. Can you swim? Just in case.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: I'll be honest with you, this is my least favourite part of the whole climb. Gods, I really need to learn how to swim.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: I quite like climbing the Steps, even though the ground is very loose and uneven. There are a few spots that are more stable for you to catch your breath though.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: If you come across a scientific instrument, do you think you could bring it back for me? I dropped it when I fell on my first climb.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: The air gets a lot thinner in Fall, so make sure you keep your breathing steady as you reach the Peak.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: It's so windy up there this time of year, take care to ensure that you don't get blown off the top of the Mountain.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: The Peak is-- well, I don't want to ruin the surprise for you. But it's breathtaking, truly. Being on top of the world.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Hey, while you're up on the Peak, do you think you could find a way to water the plants up there?

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: If you need more advice for the climb, I would recommend asking Oz. I owe most of my knowledge to them.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Oz is wonderful, you should stop in and visit them in Pistachio on your way to your next climb. I think they're lonely, and they would like to have a visitor. Even if you're, well, a Quingee.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Here, let me give you a note to give to Oz if you stop by, I'll ask them to make you a broth-- it tastes horrible, but it stops your muscles from aching the next day.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: (Sighs.) No. I do not control the frequency at which rain falls from the sky. As much as everyone wishes I could.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Do they make rainhat's in Quingee size? I think it would be a good idea to get yourself one before you climb in this weather.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: If you're climbing in this weather, make sure you take some water up with you. Sure, it's cooler than summer, but you still don't want to risk heatstroke.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: If you need a break from the warmth, it'll get cooler the higher you climb, even though you're getting closer to the Sun. Funny how that works, isn't it?

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: These are my favourite days to climb. If you make it to the top, you have to pass through the clouds themselves, how cool is that! You'll get to be inside a cloud!

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: If you see clouds that are thin and wispy, similar to hair, they're called cirrus clouds. I named my Kasoot after them, maybe you should meet her sometime?

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Those really clumpy clouds, the ones that look fluffy? They're cumulus clouds, and most of the time they bring rainfall with them.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: The clouds that seem to go on forever and ever in a big sheet, like a blanket, those are stratus clouds!

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Have you ever seen the clumpy clouds that make one big really tall structure? That's a cumulonimbus, they reach as high as clouds can go, and they bring thunderstorms with them!

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Did you know that fog is just cloud at ground level? So when you're outside in the fog, you're walking in a cloud.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Since the clouds will block out some light, it might be harder to see sometimes. You should take something with you that can make light.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: I don't like going outside when it's windy, my hair gets all blown around and gets tangled. You're lucky, having feathers. Feathers can't get tangled.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: The higher you get, the windier it is. And it's already pretty windy down here, so be careful as you climb higher and higher. Don't want you getting blown away.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Being as light as you are, you should try to weigh yourself down with (the item for windy days) so you don't get blown away!

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Are you sure you want to climb with weather this bad? Maybe this should be a rest day, run some errands, see what everyone is up to.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Look, I know it isn't *the* Storm, but it's still a storm. And sure, it'll be fine once you make it past the cloudline, but getting there will be really dangerous.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: This storm is going to bring lightning with it, be careful not to get struck by it or you might look like a Thunderstruck for a few days. Either that or-- actually, no. Forget I went to say anything else.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: If you make it to the cloud line in this weather, as you pass through the cloud you might get hit by some little pieces of hail, so watch out for those.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Storms are a mixture of wind and clouds and rain! So, you should try and prepare for all three of those.

after meeting Quingee on the mountain.key: after meeting Quingee on the mountain

after Quingee makes decent progress up t.key: after Quingee makes decent progress up the mountain

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Good progress so far! It gets easier each time you climb, so don't get discouraged, you'll make it up there eventually!

after Quingee makes progress up the moun.key: after Quingee makes progress up the mountain

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: That must've taken you a while, right? With your little legs? Good work though, you'll get there eventually.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Gods, even my legs ache after I make it all the way up there, and I don't need to take as many steps as you.

after Quingee first visit to the Institu.key: after Quingee first visit to the Institute

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Oh, hello! I didn't know if you'd end up coming by or not. I'll be honest, I didn't expect to be giving weather forecasts to a Quingee but the more the merrier.

after Quingee becomes a regular visitor.key: after Quingee becomes a regular visitor

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: I didn't know Quingee's were so interested in the weather, or climbing the Peak either, or is that just you [[name]]?

after Quingee becomes a regular visitor.key: after Quingee becomes a regular visitor and has reached the Peak (if that is possible? all good if not!)

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: You're getting pretty good at climbing it sounds like, maybe we should climb together sometime?

after receiving a gift you like.key: after receiving a gift you like

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: How did you know I like this? Oh, thank you so much! Is there some way I can repay you?

after receiving a gift you don't like.key: after receiving a gift you don't like

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Oh, uh, thanks. I'm sure I can find... something to do with this.

after receiving a gift you're neutral ab.key: after receiving a gift you're neutral about

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Thank you for the thought, I really appreciate it.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Ah-- you see, I actually can't have milk. At all. I think you should give this to someone else, it's wasted on me.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Have you visited Town Hall? I believe Oleander works there, he knows a lot about plants if you need to learn anything about them. Tell him I say hi!

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: You should visit Bullfrog sometime, at the Trading Post. I'm sure if there's anything you need help with he'll be able to help!

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: I've climbed up the mountain with Zane before, and Cap too! Helping to train them for rescue jobs, hopefully you won't need those.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: I should introduce you to Cyrus sometime, maybe it'll help him like Quingee's a bit more. He finds your eyes unnerving.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Have you met Tadhana yet? She'd love you. Maybe too much, I wouldn't put it past her to build a shrine for you or something.

mention a resident (piper) (after quinge.key: mention a resident (piper) (after quingee is a regular if that's possible?)

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: I'm technically a Doctor, did you know that? Not a medical Doctor, so please don't come to me for that, but a Doctor of Meteorology.

lines.name: Piper
lines.text: Be careful walking around in Butternut, someone's dug a large hole in their front yard and we don't want you falling in there.
